Clean up gemspec

Fix security warnings

Remove unnecessary :require option from Gemfile example

`Bundler.require` automatically loads lib/rack/cors.rb even if there is no :require option.

This can be verified by the following code:

```rb
require "bundler/inline"

gemfile do
  source "https://rubygems.org"

  gem "rack-cors"
end

puts defined?(Rack::Cors)
```

```
$ ruby example.rb
constant
```

Merge branch 'jjb-patch-2'
Merge branch 'patch-2' of https://github.com/jjb/rack-cors into jjb-patch-2

Keep null origins from masquarding as "file://"

Browsers send null origins when an iframe contains html code for its
source instead of a URL. This means that websites who used rack-cors and
allowed "file://" were open to attacks from malicious pages that used
this fact to send "null" origins.

Merge pull request #105 from eoinkelly/readme-regex

Replace ^$ with \A\z in the README regexp examples

Replace ^$ with \A\z in the README regexp examples

`^$` match the start and end of lines. `\A\z` match the start and end of
the whole string. This change makes the regexp syntax match the wording
used in the security note in the README.

Version 0.4.0

Merge pull request #77 from julik/symbol-leak

Fix a potential symbol leak

Fix a potential symbol leak

The previous implementation would allow an attack by submitting requests with
randomly-generated 'Access-Control-Request-Method' to fill the symbol table
of the server process. This is especially dangerous on Ruby < 2.2 because the
symbols will not be GCed, ever.

Merge pull request #71 from Quimbee/master

Fixes bug where Vary header was omitted in certain occasions

Fixes bug where Vary header was omitted in certain occasions

As explained in
http://www.fastly.com/blog/best-practices-for-using-the-vary-header/
responses should ALWAYS include `Vary: Origin` if there's a chance for
the response to differ depending on the Origin header in the request.

This covers the case for when 2 requests for the same resource, one
including the Origin header and the other not including it, should have
different responses. If the Vary header doesn't mention Origin, then
intermediary caches (like any CDN) will cache the response (including
its headers) and will use it regardless of the request including the
Origin header or not.

This is to play nice with caches. Otherwise rack-cors can't be used with
caches in certain situations.

Merge pull request #4 from blt04/credentials

Fix credentials option setting

Fix credentials option setting

Fixes a bug that prevented setting :credentials to false

Don't expose allowed origins on resources that support credentials

According to the latest CORS spec [1] preflight response should set
Access-Control-Allow-Origin header to '*' only if resource doesn't support
credentials (Section "5.2 Preflight request" [2], step 7).

[1]: http://www.w3.org/TR/2010/WD-cors-20100727/
[2]: http://www.w3.org/TR/2010/WD-cors-20100727/#resource-preflight-requests
